An Enthroned Old Man Offering Two Children to Heaven,

objnote.p: A pencil sketch of a female with a horse's head, perhaps Hippa, is on the verso of this water color.

illustration.illusobjdesc: In the center of the design, an old man sits on an elaborate, Gothic style throne as two children kneel on either side of him. The old man has short, curly, white hair and a similarly curly white beard. He wears a long-sleeved gown that gathers in folds to cover his feet. He sits, facing forward, with his upper body and shoulders held erect. His eyes stare blankly toward the viewer, and his mouth opens slightly beneath his heavy mustache. The man raises both arms at nearly 45 degrees away from his knees, and his partly visible palms turn to face the viewer. His fingers are spread. Leaning on the old man's knees are two children-one girl and one boy-who kneel facing one another.The girl at left wears a long-sleeved gown with an adornment on the right side. She has long hair that curls into ringlets at the ends. She kneels, facing right, with her legs extended behind her. She leans forward to rest her right elbow on the old man's right knee. Her arm bends upward, and her palm is raised, facing away from the viewer and toward the old man's waist. Her left arm is not visible, but it may be raised behind her right arm with hands clasped in a position of prayer. Her head tilts downward, and she appears to gaze at the ground. At the old man's left knee is a young boy with short, curly hair. He wears a skirt that may be fastened at his waist with a belt, but he is nude from the waist up. The boy kneels, facing left, with his legs extended behind him. Rather than bending forward at the knees and waist like his female companion, the boy hunches his shoulders forward to rest his chest and bent left arm on the old man's left knee. His upper body faces away, showing the viewer most of his back. His left arm bends sharply, and he may rest his head on his left hand. The boy's head tilts downward, and he looks at the ground between the old man's feet. The man supports these two children from a seated position on a throne, only the back of which is visible. It rises to a point above the man's head, almost giving the illusion that he is wearing a pointed hat. This largest center point may bear a decorative topper at its apex. On either side, smaller decorative points rise above the man's shoulders. The scene is framed by several large columns behind the three figures, and a canopy over their heads. This structure may be composed of six pillars and a thatch roof, or of six tall trees whose branches gather to provide a covering. In the gaps between these pillars or trees, blue skies and clouds hover over a vague landscape that may contain hills or trees, and possibly a river at left. These background details suggest that the throne sits in a gazebo or outdoor shelter of some sort, and that the scene takes place during the daytime. The foreground, however, is much darker, and prominent shadows appear in the thatch or branches over the figures' heads,in the folds of the old man's gown, and behind the boy, in the lower right corner of the design.
